isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Work Light With Truck

svcproc.title: Work Light With Truck
svcproc.para: Power is fed from the batteries to junction block (J1), circuit 14D, fuse F21, and a black wire to the work light switch (199). When the switch is move to the on position, power will flow through the switch indicator lamp, and a white wire to cab ground causing it to illuminate.

For trucks with the standard work light, when the work light switch is in the on position, power flows through a black wire and connector (127) to the orange work light pigtail causing the work light to illuminate. The ground path is through the white light pigtail, connector (127), and a white wire to rear cab ground.

For trucks with the optional single Truck-light work light, when the work light switch is in the on position, power flows through both a yellow and green wire, a black wire to the work light pigtail, causing the work light to illuminate. The ground path is through the white light pigtail, and a white wire to the rear cab ground.

For trucks with the optional dual Truck-light work lights, when the work light switch is in the on position, power flows through both a yellow and green wire, a black wire to the black work light pigtails, causing the work lights to illuminate. The ground path is through the white light pigtails, and a white wire to the rear cab ground.
